elements.title: Andrea Navagero (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that much to his dismay, Andrea Navagero (pictured) was named the Venetian ambassador to France in 1529?

elements.title: a major anime piracy website (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a major anime piracy website had over 100 million monthly visits and was one of the top 200 most popular Internet properties?

elements.title: Council Working Parties (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that while Council Working Parties only formally prepare decisions of the Council of the European Union, they de facto shape the majority of those decisions?

elements.title: Norma Phillips (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that actress Norma Phillips starred in a 52-episode silent film series in 1914 that interviewed real-life celebrities?

elements.title: found in the spring of Tattarisuo (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that mutilated body parts found in the spring of Tattarisuo in 1931 were used to practice black magic?

elements.title: Dezső Varga (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Dezső Varga was the first Szekler ice hockey player to be inducted into the IIHF Hall of Fame?

elements.title: no net loss (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that at least 69 countries have "no net loss" environmental policies?

elements.title: Madhavi (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in Hindu mythology, Madhavi, who was blessed with the miraculous ability to regain her virginity after each childbirth, was married to three kings, each in exchange for 200 rare horses?

elements.title: ending of the TV series Community (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the ending of the TV series Community features a fourth-wall-breaking monologue?
